Description: Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater reconstructed from numerous sherds and plaster inserts; interior glazed black with reserved band below rim; exterior: edge of rim black; red-figure laurel leaf and berry frieze on rim; below on side A, red-figure decoration depicting naked youth on chariot to right (upper body with added white fillet in hair and goad in right hand remaining; in the centre, Athena to right holding a laurel wreath (helmeted head and part of wreath with added white detailing remaining); towards young helmeted warrior wearing a chlamys, holding a spear and two javelins, to left; to their right, a small, possibly wingless, Nike holding a white ribbon, to left; on side B, red-figure decoration consisting of standing figures; from left, bearded male wearing a cloak and holding a sceptre, to right; in centre, helmeted warrior with chlamys, holding a shield in his left hand and a spear in his right, to left; at far right, winged Nike holding a greave in each hand, to left; under each handle palmette and tendril decoration; around handle root, short tongue pattern frieze; below, maeander and square pattern frieze; remainder of vase is plaster.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: The Group of Polygnotos (Guglielmi Painter)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Royal Museum of Art and History, Brussels. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Also mentioned in JHS, 59, p. 150; AJA, 1938, p. 316; Antike Kunst, 1962, p. 53.
Bibliographic references: CVA Brussels II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Belgique (p. 5, pl. 10, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1011)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Musées Royaux d’Art et d’Histoire, Brussels
Acquisition notes: Purchased in Cairo by M. Mabinau
